title: Clinical Order Workflows
introduction:
The Clinical Order Workflow framework covers the workflow steps from initial order until order completion/close, including any order modifications, requests for additional information, and cancellations. This framework may be applied at minimum to the following domains:  

- Laboratory (including specimen collection procedures, genomic, pathology)  
- Durable Medical Equipment  
- Specialty Referrals (including consultation/specialty providers, speech/occupational/physical therapy, and post-acute care/rehab/hospice)  
- Nutrition  
- Imaging - in coordination with Imaging Integration Work Group  
- Social Services  
- Procedures (surgery / EKG / pulmonary functions/vitals)  
- Medication - in coordination with Pharmacy Work Group  
- Administration of biological derived products (e.g. blood transfusion)  
- Point of Care (including Patient Performed Testing)  

This Implementation Guide covers (but is not limited to) the following use cases:  

1. Lab: cover reference lab forwarding, identifying copy to providers, result release restrictions  
2. Social Service Referrals  
3. Durable Medical Equipment  
4. Handling of prior authorization, information for coverage / billing in orders
descmd: STU 1.0 Ballot release. This is the first release of the FHIR Clinical Order Workflows Implementation Guide
